result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Shanahan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised the defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent upon his release.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order denying request for release privileges and electronic monitoring.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for release privileges.
Letter to defendant requesting additional information.
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence (i.e. sentence credit).

Defendant Michael J Shanahan in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael J Shanahan in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent upon his release.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Statements made by Cynthia S.  Case passed to 1:30 pm for sentencing.

Defendant Michael J Shanahan in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael J Shanahan in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
eputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.

Defendant Michael J Shanahan in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Michael J Shanahan in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Due to court calendar congestion, matter is adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Shanahan in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/06/15 in Branch 40.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Michael J Shanahan not in court, in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CINDY S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael J Shanahan in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
